description: Mapping from half-antidiagonal reading of the triangle (as used in A028297) to the column-by-column reading (as usual in EIS) of the triangular tables.
comments: Moves squares (A000290) to triangular numbers (A000217), i.e. A056536[A000290[i]] = A000217[i] for all i >= 1This sequence may be regarded as a triangular array read by rows : 1; 2; 4, 3; 7, 5; 11, 8, 6; 16, 12, 9; 22, 17, 13, 10; .... with row sums : A079824 = [1, 2, 7, 12, 25, 37, 62, 84, ...] . - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Feb 16 2004
links: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
maple: triang_perm := proc(upto_d) local a,i,j; a := []; for i from 1 to upto_d do for j from 1 to floor((i+1)/2) do a := [op(a),binomial((i-j)+1,2)+j]; od; od; RETURN(a); end;
author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 20, 2000
